string_data:
PRIMARY: Marcus Decker, a German climate activist, climbed the Queen Elizabeth Bridge over the Dartford Crossing and unveiled a Just Stop Oil banner in October 2022. He received a prison sentence of two years and seven months and faces deportation. The protest lasted less than two days and was described as peaceful with no one harmed.

SECONDARY: Fellow protester Morgan Trowland received a three-year jail term for the same action and was released in December.

OTHER FOCAL: About 600 artists including Bob Geldof, Olivia Colman and Emma Thompson are urging the Home Office to withdraw the deportation order. Over 150,000 people have signed a petition against the deportation, and UN special rapporteur Michel Forst has criticized the UK's crackdown on environmental protest.

TONE: The article presents the protest and protesters sympathetically, emphasizing the peaceful nature of the action and framing the punishment as disproportionate.
